item.title: New Fortnite Update Makes An Extremely Rare and Powerful Feature Easier to Find
item.description:
Summary

  • Fortnite now has five Earth Sprites, making it easier to find them for powerful items.
  • Earth Sprites guarantee Legendary items and are essential for a new Chapter 6 Season 1 Quest.
  • Magic Mosses and Flooded Frogs area is prime for finding Earth Sprites in Fortnite.

A new Fortnite update increases the number of Earth Sprites available in the game to five, which makes it easier to find them. Earth Sprites were released as part of the Chapter 6 Season 1 Update in Fortnite , and they have quickly become one of the most sought aspects considering they can help players get really powerful weapons very early on in the game.

After an eventful collaboration with Marvel, the sixth Chapter of Fortnite introduces a Japanese theme for fans. The updates add an all-new map featuring a plethora of exciting POIs, alongside new weapons, mythics, and much more. While fans are always eager to try out the new features in the update, one feature has remained quite elusive. Thankfully, that is no longer the case.

In a new tweet, Fortnite reveals that it is increasing the number of Earth Sprites available in the game. Since their release, only two Earth Sprites have been spawning on the map. These two Earth Sprites appear at a random location in Fortnite , out of a total of twenty-two possible spawn points. However, after the new update, five Earth Sprites will be spawning on the map.

What Are Earth Sprites Used For in Fortnite?

Earth Sprites are creatures just like Water and Air Sprites, but they serve a different use. While Water and Air Sprites in Fortnite are used to get certain perks in the game and are easily found, Earth Sprites are much harder to find due to their low spawn rate. Players can interact with Earth Sprites and get extremely powerful items in return. What makes them so powerful is that it is a guaranteed way of getting Legendary items, which typically take a lot of searching and luck to acquire.

Fortnite fans are quite elated to see the change, as many noted that they were unable to encounter an Earth Sprite despite playing the new season since its launch. What makes things even worse is the fact that Earth Sprites are also required to complete one of the Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 1 Quests. After this change, players should likely be able to complete the quest with much more ease, since it drastically increases the odds of finding them in the game. In fact, some fans added that they are easily able to spot them after the change. The Magic Mosses and Flooded Frogs area is regarded as the best area to find them, so players should definitely check them out to improve their chances.

item.title: Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake: Every Healing Spell, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Prioritize effective healing spells like Fullheal and Omniheal in Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake to ensure survival.
  • Midheal and Multiheal are efficient mid-to-late game options for healing all allies in combat.
  • Avoid using spells like Sheen and Cock-a-Doodle-Doo as they have limited utility and better alternatives exist.

When strategizing team composition in a JRPG, having access to healing is very important. Dragon Quest 3, like many other RPGs from that era of gaming, requires the player to think long and hard about which classes they want to prioritize when it comes to their team composition.

Effective healing is non-negotiable, and in Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake there are 11 healing spells to choose from when in a combat situation. Some of the spells are much better than others and, while the player may have access to the entire list, certain spells should be prioritized.

11 Sheen

Breaks Curse On One Ally

  • Mana Cost : 18 MP

The absolute worst healing spell in Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake is Sheen . Just because it is at the bottom when it comes to strength, it is still useful in certain scenarios.

However, most of the time it just isn't worth it. Curse is a pretty rare status ailment to begin with, and Sheen's high mana cost makes it only useful for a short portion of the game. The other spells simply have broader utility.

10 Cock-A-Doodle-Doo

Wakes All Allies From Sleep

  • Mana Cost : 3 MP

Cock-a-Doodle-Doo is similar to Sheen in the fact that it is only useful in a very specific use case. However, sleep is manageable with other, better, strategies and items.

The best healing spells tend to be useful in many different scenarios. The only reason for a player to use Cock-a-Doodle-Doo is if they don't have Rousing Rings equipped or their team comp cannot handle taking damage to wake up naturally.

9 Tingle

Cures Paralysis For One Ally

  • Mana Cost : 6 MP

While paralysis is a worse ailment than sleep and curse, it still isn't present enough for Tingle to be considered a "good" spell.

Being paralyzed is much more disruptive than being put to sleep, but the fact that this spell only targets one ally makes it not worth the 6 MP cost. Like the other status ailment-curing spells in the game, there are just too many ways to deal with ailments without using MP.

8 Squelch

Cures Poison For One Ally

  • Mana Cost : 3 MP

Poison is by far the worst status ailment in Dragon Quest 3 2D-HD Remake because it's a much more common occurrence than any of curse, sleep, or paralysis.

That being said, it falls into the same pitfalls as the other status ailments in that it's easily dealt with. Antidotes are easily accessible and affordable. While the cost of Squelch is only 3 MP, that 3 MP could be used for any of the other, better spell options in terms of healing.

7 Heal

Heals 30 HP For One Ally

  • Mana Cost : 3 MP

Heal is a phenomenal early-game spell. It is cheap and efficient, and will reliably restore 30 HP to any member of the party.

Instead of wasting mana curing status ailments, it would make much more sense for the player to just use Heal instead. Spending 3 MP a few times might buy enough time for the player to make it back to town and heal up more thoroughly.

6 Zing

50% Chance Of Reviving One Ally With Half HP

  • Mana Cost : 10 MP

Being able to revive an ally is crucial. Reviving party members is a tedious task that usually requires backtracking to a town and spending gold.

Sometimes it will be worth it to gamble on the success of Zing, which has a 50% chance of reviving a downed party member. However, with that gruesome 10 MP cost, the spell is seen by most players as being too risky, especially in situations where they need it to succeed.

5 Midheal

Heals 80 HP For All Allies

  • Mana Cost : 5 MP

Midheal is a solid mid-game healing spell. Once learned, the weaker Heal spell will most likely never be used again, mostly because instead of healing just one party member, it heals all of them, and for more HP than Heal can manage.

Despite a few spells outclassing it, Midheal will still have its use cases. This is a very cheap and massive heal that can carry players through the mid and late-game.

4 Kazing

Resurrects A Fallen Ally

  • Mana Cost : 20 MP

Reliable resurrection is game-changing, especially in this game's more difficult encounters. Kazing , much like other spells in the game, will replace its lesser counterpart. There is no reason to ever use Zing once players have learned Kazing. The one downside, though, is that Kazing has a high mana cost.

Once players have access to the best spells in the game, it makes more sense to spend that MP keeping allies alive instead of using it to revive them. However, if the need arises, Kazing is guaranteed to revive a downed ally, instead of its success being the equivalent of a coin toss.

3 Multiheal

Heals 80 HP For All Allies

  • Mana cost: 18 MP

Multiheal is the best of both worlds when compared to the other healing spells in Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake .

The spell is incredibly efficient, as it heals all allies for 80 HP, and its mana cost isn't too bad either. Once learned, it will take over most of the use cases of Midheal and Heal, and will continue to be useful well into the late game.

2 Fullheal

Full Restores HP For One Ally

  • Mana Cost : 7 MP

Fullheal is arguably the best healing spell in the game. It has it all. It is a low mana-cost spell that fully restores the HP of an ally without any extra mechanics or gimmicks.

This spell is invaluable in single-target scenarios and players can even dedicate their healer to using this spell every single turn, since there is very little negative to repeated uses. It simply does not get better than Fullheal.

1 Omniheal

Restores All HP For All Allies

  • Mana Cost : 62 MP

The only healing spell that could be debated as the best healing spell in Dragon Quest 3 Hd-2D Remake is Omniheal . It is a full heal for the entire party, restoring the HP of every party member.

Omniheal is a lifesaver in the game's toughest fights. Full-party heals guarantee survival, so even though the spell has an immense 62 MP cost, it's often worthwhile in certain situations. However, a dedicated healer spamming Fullheal will be better more times than not, but when things are going bad in a hurry, Omniheal can save the day.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: Is There Level Scaling
item.description:
Path of Exile 2 is an always-online game with there being many ways of interacting with other players, be they friends or random people. With other players, you can form guilds and parties and play co-op through the base campaign and endgame content, or just simply talk in the world chat.

When playing in a party, there is no restriction to joining and playing with friends in terms of level, letting even your strongest character jump into a party with a brand new character. Level scaling is crucial for playing with friends, but how exactly does it work?

How Does Level Scaling Work In Path of Exile 2?

Path of Exile 2 does have level scaling, and it can be toggled on or off when playing in a party. Only the leader of a party can determine if there is level scaling in a party. If level scaling is enabled:

  • Higher-level characters will be scaled down .
  • There is no experience penalty , though the higher-level character will only get as much XP as the weaker enemies usually drop.


You can also choose to play the game with level scaling turned off:

  • No character's level or strength is modified.
  • There is an XP penalty for lower-leveled characters, so they won't shoot up in level for fighting high-level enemies.

While disabling level scaling will lower the amount of XP the lower-level character gets, they will still get a normal amount and level up just as efficiently as when playing with level scaling turned on . Each area in the game has a specific level or range of levels that enemies will spawn at. With level scaling disabled, the level for each area will be a good indicator of where your party should be at before trying it out.

When playing alone, there is no level scaling and your settings won't affect the game at all.

How To Enable Or Disable Level Scaling In Path of Exile 2

Only the party leader can enable or disable level scaling, much like Crossplay. If you are the party leader, open up the main menu and go to settings. Tab over to, "Game" and towards the bottom of the list is Default Level Downscaling , which is this game's version of level scaling. Enabling that setting will activate Level Scaling, and disabling it will disable level scaling. This setting can also be changed at any time and the effects will be immediate for the rest of the party.

item.title: Sonic The Hedgehog: 8 Characters Who Deserve Their Own Movie
item.description:
Summary

  • Rouge could star in a spy thriller to explore her mysterious backstory.
  • Black Doom's rise to power could provide a thrilling character study in a movie.
  • An Omega movie focusing on his journey of revenge against Eggman would be a thrillride.

The Sonic the Hedgehog movie franchise is in full swing, and seeing as the third movie is placing a lot of its focus on fan-favorite character Shadow, it begs the question of who else from his immensely popular franchise could have their own big-screen adventure. Though the Sonic the Hedgehog universe has no shortage of individuals who could play the role of protagonist, the type of movie that they would be involved in would need to suit their personality for it to work.

Additionally, while one-off characters or those with only brief cameos in the games may not be the most interesting to watch, characters who are able to receive development and maybe reveal a little more about their backstory would be a perfect fit. Therefore, it’s time to take a look at which individuals within the Sonic video game universe deserve to have a movie based around them, and what exactly that movie would look like in action.

8 Rouge The Bat

A Spy Thriller Movie Featuring Rouge Could Delve Deeper Into Her Mysterious Backstory

  • First Appearance : Sonic Adventure 2

Rouge has always been a pretty mysterious character. Sure, it’s well established that she’s a cunning jewel thief who is always looking to get her hands on anything that sparkles, but why she became so obsessed with treasure, and how she became a thief in the first place, remains shrouded in obscurity.

If Rouge had her own movie, it could be made into a spy thriller that documents one of her intense escapades trying to steal away an emerald or diamond. Additionally, the movie could shed light on how she came to be this way — and if they really wanted to, it could even expand her character by fleshing out her complex relationship with Shadow. Needless to say, there’s more than enough to Rouge’s character to base a whole film around her life and hobby.

7 Black Doom

Black Doom's Rise To Power Would Make For A Thrilling Watch

  • First Appearance : Shadow The Hedgehog

Black Doom honestly feels like a character whose backstory is begging to be explored. The mysterious leader of the Black Arms is known to have amassed an army of aliens from his home planet, so if he were in a movie, the story could focus on his ruthless rise to power as part of a larger character study.

Since Doom's DNA was used to create Shadow the Hedgehog, such a movie could also insert small parts of fan service by showing Gerald Robotnik and Maria along Doom’s journey. It could also help to expand further on Doom’s cynical view of humans, with his arrival on Earth being a perfect ending shot to finish on.

6 E-123 Omega

An Omega Movie Would Have To Focus On His Journey Of Revenge Against Eggman

  • First Appearance : Sonic Heroes

A revenge movie featuring E-123 Omega as the leading star would be an absolute thrillride of a film to watch. Omega’s mission in life is simple; track down and defeat Eggman for sealing him away for so long, so being able to see Omega’s epic journey to achieving this goal would be a joy to see on the big screen.

Shadow and Rouge could also make cameos, considering they are commonly affiliated with Omega, and there could even be some exposition given about Eggman’s robots and how they view their own master.

5 Eclipse The Darkling

Exploring Eclipse's Status As The Ultimate Soldier Within A Movie Could Help Garner Sympathy For The Character

  • First Appearance : Sonic Universe #59

Eclipse was designed to be the ‘brother,’ or rather, the foil of Shadow the Hedgehog. He’s a cruel, violent, and mean-spirited imitation of his counterpart who plays a big role in the Archie comics, but what if fans were able to witness his creation and journey as part of a movie?

This could grant an insight into Eclipse as a character, how he views his position in the Black Arms, what he thinks of Black Doom, and how he compares himself to Shadow. It could even garner sympathy for Eclipse if he were to see himself as inadequate and a failed experiment, just the same as Shadow, making for some unexpected emotional moments if the directors were to ever go this direction with him.

4 Metal Sonic

Metal Sonic's Journey Could See Him Coming To The Realization Of Who He Is And Why He Was Created

  • First Appearance : Sonic CD

Metal Sonic is an AI imitation of the Blue Blur himself, created by Eggman as an attempt to capture Sonic once and for all. The reason Metal Sonic would make such an intriguing film protagonist is because of how, despite being a lethal warmachine, he also expresses signs of free will that present him as being much more complex than initially meets the eye.

While the story of an AI becoming sentient has been explored numerous times before, basing it in the Sonic universe and having Eggman be the main villain would undoubtedly still be intriguing. While a darker and more mature story could therefore be told if Metal Sonic were to star in a movie, it would also come with plenty of epic action scenes, considering the weapons that this guy is packing.

3 Jet The Hawk

From His Relationship With His Father To His Role In The Babylon Rogues, There's So Much That Could Be Explored

  • First Appearance : Sonic Riders

Jet is an arrogant but talented Extreme Gear Rider who first debuts in Sonic Riders . Despite being such a prominent character in that game, Jet’s character is barely explored, including his relationship with his dad, who is presumed to have one day been a legendary rider himself.

A movie that chronicled Jet’s journey to becoming a racer would be not only a blast to watch, given how visually stunning it would be, but also a heartfelt viewing if it were to go deep into his presumably troubled relationship with his father. There’s also the opportunity to dive deep into Jet’s rise to becoming leader of the Babylon Rogues — and how Wave and Storm came to view him as an ally.

2 Silver The Hedgehog

Silver's Time Traveling Abilities Would Make Him A Fun Movie Protagonist To Follow

  • First Appearance : Sonic The Hedgehog (2006)

Silver’s mysterious time-traveling powers would make him an excellent character to base a movie around, especially since it could easily feed into the wider universe of Sonic . Silver could travel to iconic areas of the series’ past, like Green Hill Zone and Angel Island, for example, before then moving to the future where he could show up in modern stages from the likes of Sonic Frontiers and Forces .

His relationship with Blaze could also be explored a little deeper than it was in Sonic 06 and would really go a long way in explaining more about this character who, admittedly, can seem a little confusing in the original material. If Silver doesn’t manage to show up in future Sonic movies, there’s no reason why he shouldn’t be afforded his own film when considering the kind of story that could be born from his unique powers.

1 Blaze The Cat

An Easy Way To Justify A Movie Reimagining Of Sonic Would Be To Let Blaze Take The Leading Role

  • First Appearance : Sonic Rush

There’s been an abundance of movie reimaginings and remakes over the years, and in the case of Sonic , an easy way to justify a revamp of the series in movie form would be to allow Blaze to take center stage. Similar to Sonic, Blaze is in charge of protecting a collection of precious emeralds, but she does so in an entirely different reality with different versions of existing characters.

Blaze’s universe is touched on in the Archie comics and Sonic Rush , but being able to get an entire full-length movie showing how it differs from Sonic’s world would be a real treat for longtime fans. As mentioned previously, this would also be an easy way to rejuvenate some life into the movie franchise if viewers end up ever wanting something a little more out-there and experimental.

item.title: Beloved Castlevania Collection Gets New Update
item.description:
Summary

  • Castlevania Dominus Collection gets a new Boss Rush Mode in Haunted Castle Revisited.
  • Update includes new display layouts for a better gaming experience.
  • Konami fixes bugs in the beloved Castlevania franchise collection.

The popular Castlevania Dominus Collection has received a new update patch for December, bringing with it a variety of content and various bug fixes. The beloved collection, which is composed of a variety of games from the Castlevania franchise's storied history, now features an all-new mode for one of its games, and includes new ways for players to view the screens of the titles they are playing.

Released by original developer Konami in August 2024, the Castlevania Dominus Collection primarily consists of Castlevania titles released on the Nintendo DS. This includes Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow, Castlevania: Portrait of Ruin, and Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia , which are considered some of the best Castlevania games in the series. The Castlevania Dominus Collection also includes the 1988 arcade game Haunted Castle along with a new version called Haunted Castle Revisted , the latter of which is the recipient of arguably the biggest component of the content update.

Given Castlevania Dominus Collection 's popularity despite one glaring Castlevania title omission, Konami has now released Castlevania Dominus Collection ver. 1.0.3, which adds an all-new Boss Rush Mode to Haunted Castle Revisited . The new mode has a bit of a caveat, however, as players must first beat the game in order to unlock the new mode. The update patch also adds new display layouts, which allow players to change the position of the different screens given the DS titles' dual-screen nature. While several bugs were fixed, though exactly what those were remains a mystery.

Castlevania Dominus Collection 's new update appears to be a bit more of a substantial one than its last. Castlevania Dominus Collection 's October update added new artwork for Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia along with a bug fix for Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow . The prior patch interestingly reintroduced a small glitch in Castlevania: Portrait of Ruin that seasoned players use as an exploit, with the update humorously referring to it as a feature.

Although it's been a decade since Konami released an original Castlevania title in the form of 2014's Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2, the IP has soldiered on via crossover content. The most recent example happened fairly recently with Vampire Survivors ' Ode to Castlevania DLC , which adds over 20 characters from the Castlevania franchise, including those featured in Castlevania Dominus Collection . This brings about a full-circle moment for Vampire Survivors by adding content and characters from the IP which the game is heavily inspired by. With Castlevania 's seemingly undying popularity, fans are still hoping for an all-new original title someday.

Castlevania Dominus Collection ver. 1.0.3 patch notes:

  • Added a new Boss Rush Mode in Haunted Castle Revisited
  • Added new display layouts to change the position of the different screens.
  • Fixed bugs
